Key Match Events: Jack Grealish opened the scoring with a cool finish after a lovely flick from Angel Gomes
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a sumptuous free kick from a position to the left of centre
Declan Rice got the third from a cross by Ollie Watkins, on as a substitute
Finland’s late consolation, Arttu Hoskonen running free to head home from a corner
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley needed a return to the tranquil progress of his first camp in September
England had dominated against Finland at Wembley in Carsley’s second game, creating so many chances
The idea was for more of the same; hence the recall for Gomes alongside Rice in midfield
Post-Match Reflections: Jack Grealish injected the urgency, surging off the left to find Alexander-Arnold and dart for the area
Dean Henderson, making his full England debut, saved easily
Marc Guehi slid over from left centre half to make a back three when Alexander-Arnold sortied into midfield
It felt like a slog at times for England in creative terms
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trent Alexander-Arnold bent home a sumptuous free kick from a position to the left of centre, wafting his right foot like a wand to make it 2-0
Jack Grealish had the sniff of a chance for 2-0 on 34 minutes when he took a decent first touch in the area from a floated Jude Bellingham pass and saw Matti Peltola miss his kick
